xyz.acygn.mokapot.util

Class StringifyUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • xyz.acygn.mokapot.util.StringifyUtils

  • public class StringifyUtils
extends Object
    Utilities for converting arbitrary objects to strings in a better way than Object#toString. Used to make debug messages more readable.
    Author:
    Alex Smith

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static String commaSeparateArray(Object array)
      Returns a string representation of an array with no delimiters.
      static String stringify(Object o)
      Produces a human-readable string representation of the given object.
      static String toString(Object o)
      General purpose toString operator that produces prettier output for lists and arrays.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public static String toString(Object o)
        General purpose toString operator that produces prettier output for lists and arrays. In most cases, this just uses the object's toString, but collections are shown element-wise.
        Parameters:
        o - The object to stringify.
        Returns:
        A string representation of the object.

      • commaSeparateArray

        public static String commaSeparateArray(Object array)
        Returns a string representation of an array with no delimiters. Each element of the array is converted to a string via toString, then the elements are separated using commas.
        Parameters:
        array - The array to separate. This must actually be an array, although it's declared as Object to make it more usable in toString implementations.
        Returns:
        The comma-separated string representation of the array.
        See Also:
        toString(java.lang.Object)

      • stringify

        public static String stringify(Object o)
        Produces a human-readable string representation of the given object. This is in most cases based on the object's toString, but some particularly common classes have special cases. Unlike toString, this aims to make the stringification look more like it would appear in source code, i.e. visually distinct and with an indication of the object's type.
        Parameters:
        o - The object to stringify.
        Returns:
        A stringification of the object.
